intro: Ponthieva rinconii, commonly known as the Rincón ponthieva, is a rare and critically endangered plant species native to the tropical rainforests of Colombia. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family, characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central water-holding structure. The plant produces striking inflorescences with vibrant red and yellow flowers, which attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and insects. Due to habitat loss and limited natural distribution, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important subject for botanical research.
